title: Drawing, "Horseshoe Fall and Goat Island from the Canadian Bank", October 6, 1856
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on green-gray wove paper.
markings: Recto: Stamped in black ink, at lower left: Museum for Arts of Decoration - Cooper Union [Lugt 457c]
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at lower right:  2 cedar with red creeper / 3 Grape vine / Oct. 6th 1856
description: Part of Goat Island, and the Canadian Falls are shown from the Canadian bank. Trees and foliage are shown at right.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Horseshoe Fall and Goat Island from the Canadian Bank", October 6, 1856.
October 6, 1856. Graphite, brush and white gouache on green-gray wove paper.. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-33-c.
